data.heading: Timesheet
data.sContent: Timesheet Application from Cherrywork makes it easy for employees to submit timesheets on-the-go and enables organizations to configure and implement the application in few weeks. Timesheet Application comes in two versions – Xtensive and Lite
data.lContent1: Cherrywork timesheet app keeps things simple, quick yet cool by allowing workers to record time against activities on-the-go (mobile) and also enable organizations to escape long implementation cycles followed by change management.
data.lContent2: CW Timesheet Xtensive can work as a standalone application with capabilities to configure Timesheet Entry Rules, Holiday Calendars, leave and attendance recording, WBS Creation, Resource creation and allocation, Costing, Employee Mini Master, Approval Workflows and User Administration. The application can integrate with SAP modules such as SAP PPM (or SAP PS), SAP HR, and SAP CO. The standalone timesheet is easy to configure and comes with multiple workflow options.
data.lContent3: CW Timesheet Lite extends SAP CATS to Mobile and the web with advanced UX frameworks that make filling timesheets quick, easy and attractive.

data.heading: Leave & Attendance
data.sContent: Cherrywork Leave and Attendance application allows users to apply for leave, on duty and attendance hours (time-in and time-out) on-the-go. It’s out of the box capabilities to enable organizations to configure and implement the application within a few weeks. CW Leave and Attendance application comes in two variants – Xtensive and Lite.
data.lContent1: Cherrywork Leave and Attendance application allows users to apply for leave, on duty and attendance hours (time-in and time-out) on-the-go and enables organizations to configure and implement the application in few weeks. CW Leave and Attendance application comes in two variants – Xtensive and Lite.
data.lContent2: CW Leave and Attendance Xtensive can work as a standalone application with capabilities to configure leave eligibility, quotas for leave and on-duty by grades and locations, approval workflows, no leave or on-duty period by leave/on duty types, holiday calendars, optional leave, employee mini-master and user administration. This application can integrate with SAP modules such as SAP Personnel Administration, SAP CATS, SAP Time Management and SAP Payroll.
data.lContent3: CW Leave and Attendance Lite extends SAP Time Management to Mobile and The Web with advanced UX frameworks that make recording time against leave, on duty and attendance a breeze. Both the versions come with advanced features such as vacation planner, manager’s view, minimum notice by leave type, compensatory leave policy, leave liability reports, leave encouragement triggers, leave rewards, travel time and replacement.

features.fText: This tool encourages employees to plan leaves in advance so that they get desired vacation timings without compromising on work. The tool achieves this by a combination of a couple of algorithms –periodically checking (rising) leave liability, analyzing team’s leave calendar and then triggering timely notifications to the employees who have unutilized balances.

The tools also accumulate hours worked by each employee based on their time in/out entries and suggest the management list of top sluggers with eligible compensatory leaves. It also allows managers to reward employees by assigning extra leaves. It provides key insights to management such as usage of off work schedule hours, travel time spent by location and over/under working employees.

data.heading: Talent Acquisition
data.sContent: Cherrywork Talent Acquisition System differentiates itself by improving process flexibility (multiple workflows) and by improving collaboration with between stakeholders. The tool is divided into four key submodules – Requisition, Sourcing, Evaluation and Offer. They key differentiating features are requisition workflows based on vacancy type, multiple sourcing venues – portal, website, alumni, campus, partners, internal, referrals and contractors, evaluation workflows with calendar integration and offer fitment process.
data.lContent1: Talent Acquisition is a key strategy as well as a challenge for the fast-growing organizations. It becomes difficult for recruiters to keep up with the progress on each position. Cherrywork’s TA Module is a comprehensive solution that automates coordination, approvals and follows up thus allowing recruiters to focus on sourcing activities. It encourages stakeholders to complete their pending activities thus attempting to improve TAT targets. The module has been divided into the following four sub modules.
data.lContent2:
Requisition: Organization has several types of open positions - Budgeted, Non-budgeted, Replacements – that requires different approval workflows based on the grade and location of a position.

Sourcing:Once a requisition is opened and approved, a recruiter shall start sourcing it through several internal and external sources. CW supports a variety of sources as internal job postings, alumni, employee referrals, online job boards, campus, website, placement agencies and references. A recruiter can also search through the database of unsolicited or past applications to identify the matching profile. The module integrates with succession planning module thus shortlisting top (internal) candidates even if they have not applied.
data.lContent3:
Evaluation:Evaluation is the most dynamic process in Recruitment. The tool allows hiring manager or HR BP or Recruiter to assign evaluation panel at different evaluation stages. The management can create multiple evaluation workflows that get triggered depending on the grade, location and function of the position.

Offer:HR BP or Recruiter shall negotiate the offer with the shortlisted candidate. The system does fitment checks for the offer proposed and triggers the approval workflows for exceptions. A candidate shall accept/reject the offer on the portal. On acceptance, Cherrywork’s onboarding process is triggered.

Cherrywork also integrates with SAP HCM Recruitment, Personnel Administration and SF EC modules.

data.heading: On-Boarding
data.sContent: Cherrywork On-boarding app improves new hire’s joining experience while significantly reducing manual activities for Onboarding teams. It improves coordination between internal functions and external agencies, making a collaborative partnership for onboarding a new hire. The app covers processes such as background verification, medical, travel, transportation of personal effects, visa (for expats), accommodation, asset allocation, hiring in SAP, Post joining activities such as paperwork, team orientation, feedback collection, etc.
data.lContent1: On-boarding initiatives at any organizations look to achieve the following key objectives
data.lContent2:
• Protect recruitment investments by engaging activities post offer to joining
  • Reduce time-to-productivity post joining
  • Adherence to onboarding process
  • Create a great first impression!
data.lContent3: Cherrywork On-boarding app allows organizations to achieve the above objectives by digitizing well-designed process. The comprehensive app pulls new joiner’s data from CW’s TA Module and triggers the following processes.

data.heading: Learning Management
data.sContent: Cherrywork Learning Management System beats the best when it comes to identifying learning requirements, creating training plans, sourcing content from multiple digital content providers, classroom management, evaluation and certification.
data.lContent1: Changing business dynamics, compliance obligations, succession planning and employees’ career aspirations require organizations to periodically upgrade their workforce.

features.fText:
CW LMS is a comprehensive app that allows L&D to control all the training initiatives – classroom and digital - from a single dashboard. The app integrates with third party authoring tools and third-party digital content providers. CW LMS tool facilitates the process as below:
  • Collect requirements :The app provides easy-to-use UX that allows stakeholders to update the requirements on the portal.
  • Schedule Training :L&D Manager can analyze the responses and shortlists training requirements for the quarter and/or year. The app enables managers to gauge the interest by launching a dummy batch and receiving reservation requests. If enough interest is evident, the manager can launch a batch and generate enrollments. Employees interested in the training can submit the request for approval which further goes to the L&D coordinator for enrollment. Once enrolled, the participant receives notification and reminders for the training.
  • Conduct and evaluate :A participant can take either online or classroom training as defined by the L&D Team. The app facilitates classroom, online and recorded training sessions. A faculty can suggest pre-session study material or quiz that participant shall take before arriving for the session. On completion of a batch, the faculty shall evaluate each participant on the system. The app enables the coordinator to mark attendance and also enables the participant to provide feedback on the training.
  • Certify :L&D Manager/Coordinator shall then look at the performance of a participant, attendance and then decide to issue a certificate with a validity period. An employee can view/download the certificates and the same shall also be updated in employee’s IDP.
The app provides analytics for measuring effectiveness of the courses and also tracks employees'/functions' compliance towards Individual Development Plans.

features.fName: Integrations with Third Party & SAP Training & Development
features.fText: The app integrates with third party SCORM compliant content providers and authorization tools. The content plays on CW’s advanced player that supports multiple video and audio formats. It also integrates with SAP Training & Development, e-Learning, Organizational Management and Personnel Administration modules. It also integrates with SAP SF PMGM module.

data.heading: Collaborative Logistics
data.sContent: Significant efficiencies can be realized across the supply chain when all stakeholders (enterprise, vendors, and carriers) can collaborate in real time through a standardized logistics execution platform. This type of interaction is also known as collaborative logistics.
data.lContent1: The cornerstone of collaborative logistics is timely visibility. Data about orders, inventory, transportation, and spending need to all funnel into a common denominator big data repository and be readily accessible.
data.lContent2: A Web-native execution platform lends itself to the collaborative logistics execution model as it is meant to operate on the edge of the enterprise. Considered high tech for its complicated logistics algorithms in the back end, and low tech for ease of use on the front end, this type of solution empowers any stakeholder in the supply chain. As you start collaborating with a carrier agnostic system here is what you can expect:
data.lContent3:
• Visibility into transportation orders, purchase orders, shipments, exceptions, invoices, and spend
  • Real-time monitoring
  • Real-time reporting. No waiting for reports or data to be input
  • Live. If it is happening, you know about it
  • Everyone in the supply chain is collaborating around the same data

data.heading: Product Information Management
data.sContent: PIM systems generally need to support multiple geographic locations, multilingual data, and maintenance and modification of product information within a centralized catalog. Information kept by a business can be scattered throughout departments and held by employees or systems, instead of being available centrally; data may be saved in various formats, or only be available in hard copy form. Information may be needed for detailed product descriptions with prices, or calculating freight costs. PIM represents a solution for centralized, media-independent data maintenance, as well as efficient data collection, management, refinement and output.
